lead_paragraph: Khalid and Ibrahim el-Bakraoui join a list of brothers involved in nearly every major terror attack on Western soil since three sets of Saudi siblings helped carry out the 9/11 attacks.

byline.contributor: Benedict Carey contributed reporting from New York, and Kimiko De Freytas-Tamura from Brussels.
byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY, RUKMINI CALLIMACHI and SCOTT SHANE

headline.print_headline: As Siblings Again Unite to Unleash Terror, Experts Ask What Drives Them
headline.main: As Siblings Again Unite to Unleash Terror, Experts Ask What Drives Them

snippet: Khalid and Ibrahim el-Bakraoui join a list of brothers involved in nearly every major terror attack on Western soil since three sets of Saudi siblings helped carry out the 9/11 attacks.
abstract: Revelation that terrorist attacks in Brussels were in part conducted by Belgium-born brothers Khalid and Ibrahim el-Bakraoui has yet again posed question for counterterrorism experts and investigators of why brothers seem more inclined to terrorism; Bakraouis are but latest pair of male siblings who have committed terrorist acts on Western soil since September 11, 2001, attacks on United States.
